comment: Her lectures are easy to understand because she breaks down long problems into simple steps. She also has her notes online and gives plenty of examples. Taking this class in May is a big work-load.

She's extremely knowledgeable in the material however she speaks extremely fast and gives little to no explanations. She's fair but she is not understanding nor forgiving and will not allow students to redo or retake exams under ANY circumstances. This is a hard class regardless but I feel as though it would be easier with another professor
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria

comment: She is a great teacher. She understands the material is difficult and will pause after working a problem to allow students to digest.  You can use a notecard for each test except the final.  Her tests are not difficult & 40% of your grade is not tests. She offers extra credit as well. She is extremely fair.  You won't be disappointed.

Best Accounting Professor I have taken! Prof Shumate was awesome and explained everything very well. She gives a study guide and is always free if you need any help. Accounting isn't an easy course so you will have to put in the work but if you study and go to class you will absolutely get an A. 3 exams and a final all proctored. Take her!

This is a hard course but Professor Shumate makes it easier. Use her chapter examples in class to follow along and use the study guide and you will do great. The exams are hard but if you study a week or two in advance you'll be fine. She also replaces your lowest test grade if you do better on the final.

extra credit opportunities every chapter, and you can check your work unlimited times in homework which makes a difference. her tests feel a little more difficult because she adds a lot of conceptual stuff in there. cumulative final unfortunately. gives real world examples

Professor Shumate does not allow extensions for any assignments under any circumstances. Given that she only grades by a few things and your grade is heavily weighted on exams(which are near impossible to get an A on and cover material not gone over in the study guides and maybe mentioned once in class),you cannot afford to miss a single assignment
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Not exactly hard, but you do need to study. I love that she had her lectures on D2L so I can follow along in class rather than trying to listen and take notes at the same time. I suggest studying the guide where she writes every topic mentioned on the exam, they were very similar. Just study and do practice problems over and over, you'll be fine.

She was very nice but she did move fast sometimes. Class was only mandatory 9 times this semester mainly for exam days which are hard. She'll say you can email her for any questions but her email responses are vague and a bit unhelpful. I highly recommend asking questions during class her responses are much better.

The homework is not bad but the tests are required to be taken with an online proctor thru a 3rd party platform (monitor edu) and they make you use 2 devices: one for the test where they see the screen and another set to the side of you to watch you take the lecture and see your screen. Exams are hard.

Grade consists of connect SB and HW, 2 individual projects, 3 tests, and a final. She also provides many easy opportunities for extra credit, take advantage of these. Practice problems provided help prepare you for tests, but you will still need to read the book and review problems done in class. She cared about her students and was very friendly.

Where do I start? The exams and study guides never matched, and she got upset when students voiced this, saying we should be studying better and not relying on just the study guide. Accounting is already complex; the tests are in person, and you can't use any references for everything you have to remember. Make her your last choice.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Shumate was awesome! She was very clear about her grading policy and made herself available for help if needed. She provided example problems in Excel (which is appropriate) and was clear about the material in her lectures. There was quite a bit of reading and work, but she also gave extra credit opportunities. I would recommend her.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Lots of homework

comment: Prof Shumate wasn't the prof for me. She was kind, and offered 2 extra credit assignments a week worth 1 point together. Class is on a 1000-point scale. If you are not good with textbook reading and need videos to help you learn, this is not the prof for you. She is very textbook-based. 4 Exams, a budget project, and case studies. Uses proctorio.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Lots of homework

comment: GG- Attend class! Accounting requires a deep knowledge of the material. Students expect to pass but don't want to learn from someone who knows more than they do. She goes step by step with complex examples from the book. Tests are relatively easy and simply. She gives you lecture notes and examples before each test. Best accting professor I've had!

This class was tough but, the prof was very accessible through email and tried to help me as much as she could. There was little extra credit and you have to do the homework assignments if you want to pass this class. They are decently easy tho and like I said she is willing to help answer any questions

As long as you turn assignments in on time, you'll do fine in this class. Studying the material on Connect before the exams, along with the notes that she provides, really helped my latter exam grades.

A fast-paced/difficult class, but professor is knowledgeable and will answer any questions (definitely need to be in the classroo). Weekly HW and Quiz, two projects, 4 tests and one final. Classes are going through problems similar to the hw. Tests were hard because they were 100% textbook based, but the classes helped the process along. Some EC.

This class is a lot easier than Financial Accounting. Shannons uploads lectures, study guides, and formula sheets and is pretty good at communicating. Only exams are proctored. You should pass just fine if you actually study for it. Theres also an excel project.
Please take her!!

Great professor. She was very good at explaining the complex parts of intermediate accounting in a way that was understandable. Tests are proctored, but most questions come from the review. She gives a lot of extra credit. She was available outside of class to help with anything we needed.

Shes a really good professor. Her work was all on connect and the project was excel. If you took Acct2101, then you already know what to expect. Do your work and do the extra credit EVERY-TIME and you should be good!! The class is hard so make it easy for yourself.

Amazing professor. Went over a lot of helpful examples in class and answered any questions we had. Really cared for her students and is all around great. The class itself wasn't too bad, you will just have to put a lot of hours of studying into it. The material can get confusing at times, but practice helps. A lot of Connect SB and HW.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: She taught well and explained the concepts well its just the class was overall kind of difficult. SB, homework, tests, excel project, ALEKS(first 2 weeks only), and final. She also is very responsive and emails back pretty quickly.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Great acct prof. Extra credit opps for every chapter. Class is straightforward: SB, HW, Quizzes, Exams, Excel Project. The only pain was ALEKS but it was early in the semester and once we were done, it was over with it. No essays so that was nice. Very responsive via email. Wish she taught more acct classes so I could take her again.

Best professor! She goes through many examples in details and if she felt like we didnt understand the material she would go over it in detail even more. She gave us everything we needed to do well on the exams and did many examples in class. She is great!

(Synchronous, online) It would be really hard to fail this class unless you put in no effort. She is very knowledgeable & explains things very clearly. She goes through practice problems on the lectures that are the exact type of problems you do for hw & exams. Tons of little extra credit opportunities. Do every assignment & the tests will be easy.

Professor Shumate was pretty solid and taught the material well. She taught through the McGraw Hill textbook so we had to do the smartbooks and quizzes that come with it, with the tests online. Class was taught half online half in-person in groups and attendance was mandatory. Overall, she's above average and I would take her again if I could.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Shumate is an awesome professor! Accounting has lots of homework regardless of the teacher, but she makes it easy to do well based on her lectures. Tests are proctored and assignments are due every Sunday.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: 3 test on Connect with proctoring and an optional final exam that will replace your lowest test score.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Lecture heavy--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Shumate is very helpful & wants you to do well. This class uses McGraw Hill for majority of the assignments. The videos are optional but she offers bonus points for them. The quizzes are open book but the testa are not & they are recorded. Overall I enjoyed this professor & would take her again if I could. Work hard & you will do well.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor Shumate is great! There is a lot of work but this really helps you fully grasp the concepts and helps improve your overall grade.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: This class is very homework heavy. The tests are more on the homework and not like the practice exam. She grades on a curve. The quizzes are open book/open notes, but the exams require Tegrity and are closed notes/book. Although its basic math, I found it difficult to memorize all of the math equations for each scenario without using notes.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Intermediate 1 can be challenging, but Professor Shumate worked with students to make sure they had a good understanding of every topic. Her study guides for the tests are very useful, make sure you look at those. Quizzes and homework are through Connect, and she offers extra credit before each test. Do those, they add up quickly!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: ACCT 3100 is a hard class but she does teach pretty well. The extra credit really helps so make sure to do it! The tests are not easy but if you study it is doable. 3 tests and a final. I would recommend her!

This is not an easy class and you definitely need to put some work in. Prof Shumate is great and she does her best to explain the material. Attendance is not mandatory however you want to show up because the problems that she solves in class will be at the exam. Extra credit for each module. No group projects. Very down to earth and caring prof.

Summate is one of the best teachers I have had in Kennesaw. The material she covers in class can put you to sleep. But overall she will go above and beyond to help you if she sees your struggling. Going to her office hours will save you time when it comes to the harder material later in the course.
Shes a awesome professor. Tests are a little difficult but as long as you do the test reviews you will be fine!! Take her.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: She is the best professor. Test is hard so always try to do the review exam and homework.

Took her for both Intermediate I and Advanced Financial Acct. Very good professor overall. In lectures, attendance is non-mandatory, but she typically goes over many different practice problems within the book which is really helpful for the exams. Tests are calculation-heavy, and she gives plenty of practice problems to go over to prepare for them
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Lecture heavy

comment: she is the best accountant i have ever had and she is very nice and funny and she gives us good grades.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Prof Shumate was very helpful throughout the entire semester. My only complaint is that exams are recorded, which was difficult for me only because it adds a lot of extra pressure to my anxiety-ridden test-taking skills. With that said, I appreciate how much she truly cares and she is very genuine. There is a good bit of homework but it isn't hard.
Professor Shumate is a great professor. She is very responsive and helpful when needed. If you work hard and follow the course requirements you will get an A.

The lectures are long and cover a lot of material but she does a good job going over everything. The tests were hard but there is a lot of homework and extra credit to keep your grade up. I missed an A by two points without doing great on any of the tests. Do the homework and take good notes and you'll be fine.

Book is mandatory- learn smart&homework come from book. Her exams are not hard if you study. I missed 3 classes the whole semester, and managed to get an A in her acct 3100. There is a lot of time consumption put into homework. Final exam replaces lowest test grade. I did poorly on test and still passed with an A. Fair grader& gives extra credit.

Shumate is a good teacher but you definitely have to work for your grade. If you don't go to class, you'll miss the examples and you wont understand. Had an A all semester till the last test and missed the grade I need to keep an A by one point. Do the extra credit all semester cause she wont bump. Practice questions different than test

Solid professor, imo. Lectures are really not necessary unless you just wanted to stay after and work on homework or ask her any questions about the content. Very nice and approachable outside of class. Final replaces lowest test grade. Several extra credit opportunities. Would take again for advanced.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: She is an INCREDIBLE professor! By far, one of the best professors I've had! She explains all concepts very throughly, provides practices before the tests, is very accessible outside of class, answers emails quickly, AND provides extra credit that helped in understanding. If you do the work and study before tests, an A is very attainable!

Professor Shumate is a good choice. She teaches well and she lets you know just what you need for tests. Get ready to spend several hours doing HW, but I think that's the case for every accounting class. Also, she does pop-quizzes down the line, so it's in your best interest to study. She lets you use a cheat sheet for tests sometimes.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Clear grading criteria

comment: Top notch! Very nice, and super fast grader. Material is dense, she does a good job giving detailed examples and explaining it. She provided numerous extra non-graded homework for practice. Grading structure is designed for students to succeed: quizzes don't count for much, and are essentially exam prep, HW helps balance out test scores
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: In class "assignments/pop quizzes" for every chapter. Lecture heavy and will tell you what part of chapters exams will be based from however, does not give away a lot of information on what will be on exam. Study guides provide insight on what she thinks is prevalent for each chapter.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Shumate is very solid. She tests every few chapters, so its not information-overload. I would advise anyone who takes her class (or any accounting class, in general) not to skip more than 1-2 classes per semester. The material is upper-level, so you should WANT to show up anyway. Shes nice to look at, too. Oh, and DO THE HW. Easy points
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: So the class is very hard, to begin with, but then the stuff she teaches and how she teaches it is so much different than the exams!! You have to be able to think super deep and manipulate every problem so that it makes sense. She also doesn't cover concepts those are your responsibility to learn. I've taken her B4 and loved her but now not so much.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I don't know how this professor has such good reviews. Yeah maybe a handful of people make A's on the exams, but majority make 70s and below. I would honestly avoid taking her. Unless you want to study for a week straight and still fail her test.

She is the best professor I've had in the business school. This material is difficult, and she makes it so easy to understand. I will say I sit in the front of an 8am class and never miss a class. Go to class! She gives extra credit, curves on tests if average is too low. She's the best and the reason I want to continue as an Accounting major!

I took this course online over the summer. I managed to get an A however it was very self taught. You have to purchase the online code of course and read the chapters and do all the homework. As long as you do that you should be okay, also most of answers can be found online which is a plus.

Shumate is one of the best you can get for this subject!! Managed to get an A in accounting 2 so she did something right. She always responded to my emails and was very helpful. I would recommend taking this online but that is because I prefer a more flexible schedule.. 10/10 would recommend for accounting! Lots of work but it pays off!

Nice lady but hard class! do not take maymester. I thought she'd be be easy but her class is not. Tests are hard and there is a lot of homework and no time to study, sleep or eat. I'm physically and emotionally exhausted. Read text book and pay attention to lectures. she does give extra credit points sometimes. Do not take maymester for any class!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY

comment: She is one the best professors I've ever had. If you go to class most of the time and pay attention, you will easily get an A. I forgot about two quizzes (8 points of my overall grade), and still managed to get a B in the class after getting a low B on the final. She's hot. Online HW due about every 2 weeks and 3 exams. Take or for accounting!!

Her class really makes it feel like she places a low priority on teaching because various times, she would leave early, cancel class, forget notes, make errors in the notes, etc. That being said she performed her lectures really well and she's very transparent about herself as a professor.

Loved the professor but the class was hard for me. If you liked Financial Accounting then it probably won't be easy for you either but if you didn't like Financial Accounting then it will probably be easy to get an A. Lots of extra credit and homework which is why its easy to get a B. I suggest going to class because again the professor helps a lot
She is great. Spells out how to do problems. Hard class, but easy teacher.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Awesome professor. She makes plenty of mistakes but also has moments of brilliance. Her class was almost too easy, tests are super easy, homework is the most difficult part due to picky software but she will help you with any question, any time. Caring and good all around professor

Good professor and great content, which I found to be relevant to today's business world.  Two exams and a final.  Exams are tough and I felt rushed to complete them in the allotted time.  There is a decent amount of extra credit work and she replaces the lowest exam score if you score higher on your final exam.

I didn't care for her. Her teaching style is to work problems on the board from notes which is great when the prof is well prepared. She forgot her notes twice though in less than two months, once on a review day. She seemed like she knew her stuff but was just unorganized and hard to follow. Tests are hard to prep you for CPA. Take someone else.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Professor Shumate is AMAZING! 1 of my favorite professors. I ask a lot of questions & she answered them ALL. She believes in practicing problems over & over in class to help you understand the material rather than teaching from a powerpoint & trying to memorize notes. I'm taking her every chance I get. Got an A in her Intermediate 1 MAYMESTER!

Great professor. I took the class online and she was very attentive to discussion posts. She responded quickly with help and gave plenty of due date reminders. 3 exams. Study guide provided for the final. Lowest test grade replaced if you score higher on the final. Lots of extra credit. I'm not an accounting major but still got an A.

Probably one of the few professors that actually get college. She understands that a majority of her students are not accounting majors, so she makes the class structured to teach the basic concepts. 4 tests including the final. Homework assignments due every 2-3 weeks (plenty of time). Also gives a bunch of extra credit. No reason not to make an A
Second time taken her, and will take her again if I can. Fair tests, quick to reply with any questions, and very knowledgeable. She cares about her students and explains material well.

One of my favorite professors at KSU. 2 tests with a cumulative final. Homework can be time consuming, but she goes over similar problems in class before assignments are due. Extra credit opportunities. Budget project was the hardest part, but she offered an optional class to help us one-on-one. Definitely take her! (Side note: Do not need book.)

Great class and easy A if you do the work. Prof. Shumate explains material clearly and gives lots of informative handouts and examples. Lots of opportunities for extra credit. They are a little time consuming, but DO THEM - your grade will thank you. Tests are just like practice exams in Connect. Study well and you will succeed.

Hands down best Professor ive had at KSU.  Shes more than happy to help during office hours. She provides you everything you need to succeed. If you make less than a B in this class then you should switch majors. Her immense knowledge and strong people skills made this class extremely very enjoyable. I should also mention shes EXTREMELY attractive!

She has practical accounting experience from her previous job, which makes the material seem useful. She speeds through material, but will slow down if you ask. She is open to help during her office hours and responds to emails quickly. Extremely approachable. 3 tests with cumulative final. Quite a bit of homework, but not hard if you go to class.

She's extremely helpful and takes time really getting in depth of the problems she teaches. She had practice examples on Connect that helped you for the tests, follow those and you'll do well. The class itself isn't simple though, so it'll take effort. She also might give off the "I don't care about you" vibe but she's actually extremely nice.

There are 3 tests which she gives a study guide and practice questions for. If you have questions she responds to emails quickly. Her lectures are quick which is scary but if you pay attention you'll understand it. If you do the homework you should be fine on the test cause the homework is harder than the tests. Also do all of the extra credit.

She is a very sweet lady, I just wish at the beginning she gave us more information about herself. I also think that the class would have been better if she interacted more with the students and made it "fun", even though we all know accounting can be boring. Overall, she is helpful and gives many extra credit opportunities.

Whoever said she doesn't teach, is a liar. All Prof. Shumate does is work problems step-by-step; it doesn't get better than that. If you think she doesn't teach, just wait until you get a professor who expects you to read 5 chapters and bring your questions to class. Take her! She knows her stuff and makes accounting seem like a piece of cake.

Professor Shumate is nice, but to me she does not teach. She writes the problems on the board and that is what you have to use to study. If you do not understand, you will need to email her because you will not get that extra help in class, but she does respond to email within a reasonable time if you do not wait until the last minute.

Take her! You will have a lot of assignments but plenty of time to do them. She gives extra credit too. She wants you to succeed and will give you every chance to do so. You just need to apply yourself. I made 60s on both exams & final,  I did all the extra credit and all the assignments & got a B in the class. If you make below a B, you are lazy.

She is amazing! This is my second time taking accounting. The first time I had a teacher who just sat in a chair and used an excel spreadsheet to teach which was not helpful at all. Professor Shumate writes everything step-by-step on the board. Take her she is amazing!
I took Shumate for all my accounting classes (3000-4000)at SPSU. She is a great teacher and cares about you understanding the material.

I'm taking her class right now, and I've been struggling on tests. I don't think I learn well with her teaching style. At the beginning of every new chapter she writes key-points to know, and the rest of the lectures is just her working out examples from the book onto the board; which hasn't helped me learn. She's a really nice person though.

I took her Intermediate Accounting course which i did end up withdrawing from. This was due to my decision not to study as much as i should have. This was an online course which i have issues with anyway. While i was taking the class she always replied to my emails to help with the homework. Be ready to read the chapters and be able to do the HW

Took this class with Ms. Shumate online, pretty nice class, straight foward and not tough on d grading. Learned a lot since i had to teach it to myself but Ms shumate was always there to help. Hw due evey friday plus a discussion once in a while, test r not hard, just read the chapters n do ur hw and u will be fine. Love ms Shumate !!!

I loved Professor Shumate! Very clear in her teaching and very helpful when you have questions. She is a stickler about attendance though. I highly recommend Professor Shumate. And yes, she is very pretty :-)
Last semester, I took her SPSU Orientation class. Easy class to get an easy A. We just meet every other week. All the assignments can be done before the end of the semester. Very cute professor!

Very good professor. Clear and straight forward. Tests can be challenging, MAKE SURE YOU READ THE CHAPTER! And oh yea, she is beautiful and from what I can see she doesn't have a ring on that finger ;)

Professor Shumate is a terrific professor.  She is the most helpful professors that I have ever had.  Although she presents a tough exterior on the outside she is a very sweet lady on the inside.  She is the type of person that gets things done in a prompt manner so there are no grading delays.  I highly recommend her as an accounting professor.
I love her.  She is a great professor.  Unfortunately, I don't have much time to spend in accounting.
Great Teacher. I took her online and she gave lots of examples as well as feedback. She is also my advisor @ SPSU and she is extremely helpful. She is by far a great accounting teacher!!!

Prior to class, read the chapter and try to understand it and take the reading quiz, which is fairly easy if you read. Then she will explain more in class and you should have a better understanding. After that attempt the HW and ask her questions if you have trouble. If you put in the time and work, you can make an easy A. She is the best!!
Very helpful, easy to communicate with. Best Accounting teacher at SPSU!

Great teacher. Pretty much the only teacher that uses examples that are NOT in the book. She does a variety of examples. No excuse for not understanding Accounting after taking her class. GREAT Professor. Highly recommended!!
Wish I could marry her.  Soooooo cute.  As far as a teacher she is very helpful.  I would recommend her to anyone.
She is really cute! Did I mention that she is really cute?  She is very helpful and is a pretty easy proff.

This teacher is WAY HOT!! I had here 2 or 3 semesters ago. She works with you as far as getting all of your homework turned in even if its alittle late, and prepares you for the tests. She's a must have for accounting! and did i mention she really hot. War Eagle!!
No Comments
